paragraphs.content: The burden of the word of the LORD in the land of Hadrach, and Damascus shall be the rest thereof: when the eyes of man, as of all the tribes of Israel, shall be toward the LORD.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The burden of the word of the Lord in the land of Hadrach, and Damascus shall be the rest thereof: when the eyes of man, as of all the tribes of Israel, shall be toward the Lord.

paragraphs.content: And Hamath also shall border thereby; Tyrus, and Zidon, though it be very wise.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And Hamath also shall border thereby; Tyrus, and Zidon, though it be very wise.

paragraphs.content: And Tyrus did build herself a strong hold, and heaped up silver as the dust, and fine gold as the mire of the streets.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And Tyrus did build herself a strong hold, and heaped up silver as the dust, and fine gold as the mire of the streets.

paragraphs.content: Behold, the Lord will cast her out, and he will smite her power in the sea; and she shall be devoured with fire.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Behold, the Lord will cast her out, and he will smite her power in the sea; and she shall be devoured with fire.

paragraphs.content: Ashkelon shall see it, and fear; Gaza also shall see it, and be very sorrowful, and Ekron; for her expectation shall be ashamed; and the king shall perish from Gaza, and Ashkelon shall not be inhabited.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Ashkelon shall see it, and fear; Gaza also shall see it, and be very sorrowful, and Ekron; for her expectation shall be ashamed; and the king shall perish from Gaza, and Ashkelon shall not be inhabited.

paragraphs.content: And a bastard shall dwell in Ashdod, and I will cut off the pride of the Philistines.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And a bastard shall dwell in Ashdod, and I will cut off the pride of the Philistines.

paragraphs.content: And I will take away his blood out of his mouth, and his abominations from between his teeth: but he that remaineth, even he, shall be for our God, and he shall be as a governor in Judah, and Ekron as a Jebusite.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And I will take away his blood out of his mouth, and his abominations from between his teeth: but he that remaineth, even he, shall be for our God, and he shall be as a governor in Judah, and Ekron as a Jebusite.

paragraphs.content: And I will encamp about mine house because of the army, because of him that passeth by, and because of him that returneth: and no oppressor shall pass through them any more: for now have I seen with mine eyes.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And I will encamp about mine house because of the army, because of him that passeth by, and because of him that returneth: and no oppressor shall pass through them any more: for now have I seen with mine eyes.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Rejoice greatly, O daughter of Zion; shout, O daughter of Jerusalem: behold, thy King cometh unto thee: he is just, and having salvation; lowly, and riding upon an ass, and upon a colt the foal of an ass.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Rejoice greatly, O daughter of Zion; shout, O daughter of Jerusalem: behold, thy King cometh unto thee: he is just, and having salvation; lowly, and riding upon an ass, and upon a colt the foal of an ass.

paragraphs.content: And I will cut off the chariot from Ephraim, and the horse from Jerusalem, and the battle bow shall be cut off: and he shall speak peace unto the heathen: and his dominion shall be from sea even to sea, and from the river even to the ends of the earth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And I will cut off the chariot from Ephraim, and the horse from Jerusalem, and the battle bow shall be cut off: and he shall speak peace unto the heathen: and his dominion shall be from sea even to sea, and from the river even to the ends of the earth.

paragraphs.content: As for thee also, by the blood of thy covenant I have sent forth thy prisoners out of the pit wherein is no water.
paragraphs.contentHtml: As for thee also, by the blood of thy covenant I have sent forth thy prisoners out of the pit wherein is no water.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Turn you to the strong hold, ye prisoners of hope: even to day do I declare that I will render double unto thee;
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Turn you to the strong hold, ye prisoners of hope: even to day do I declare that I will render double unto thee;

paragraphs.content: When I have bent Judah for me, filled the bow with Ephraim, and raised up thy sons, O Zion, against thy sons, O Greece, and made thee as the sword of a mighty man.
paragraphs.contentHtml: When I have bent Judah for me, filled the bow with Ephraim, and raised up thy sons, O Zion, against thy sons, O Greece, and made thee as the sword of a mighty man.

paragraphs.content: And the LORD shall be seen over them, and his arrow shall go forth as the lightning: and the Lord GOD shall blow the trumpet, and shall go with whirlwinds of the south.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And the Lord shall be seen over them, and his arrow shall go forth as the lightning: and the Lord God shall blow the trumpet, and shall go with whirlwinds of the south.

paragraphs.content: The LORD of hosts shall defend them; and they shall devour, and subdue with sling stones; and they shall drink, and make a noise as through wine; and they shall be filled like bowls, and as the corners of the altar.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The Lord of hosts shall defend them; and they shall devour, and subdue with sling stones; and they shall drink, and make a noise as through wine; and they shall be filled like bowls, and as the corners of the altar.

paragraphs.content: And the LORD their God shall save them in that day as the flock of his people: for they shall be as the stones of a crown, lifted up as an ensign upon his land.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And the Lord their God shall save them in that day as the flock of his people: for they shall be as the stones of a crown, lifted up as an ensign upon his land.

paragraphs.content: For how great is his goodness, and how great is his beauty! corn shall make the young men cheerful, and new wine the maids.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For how great is his goodness, and how great is his beauty! corn shall make the young men cheerful, and new wine the maids.
